comment: Sample: USB drive format operation was successful
Description: USB drive format operation was %s
Format: USB drive format operation was %s
Name: Generate system diagnostic file failed
Sample: Generate system diagnostic file to USB drive failed
Description: Generate system diagnostic file to %s failed
Format: Generate system diagnostic file to %s failed
Variables: Generate system diagnostic file to ${device} failed
Name: Periodic support snapshot is enabled
Sample: System periodic support snapshot is enabled
Description: System periodic support snapshot is enabled
Format: System periodic support snapshot is enabled
Sample: Exported system diagnostic file to server successfully
Description: Exported system diagnostic file to %s successfully
Format: Exported system diagnostic file to %s successfully
Variables: Generate system diagnostic file to ${device} successfully
Name: Reset to the default configuration failed
Sample: The default configuration settings were not restored after a system reset.
Description: Reset to the default configuration failed when the device was rebooted.
Format: Reset to the default configuration failed when the device was rebooted.
Sample: Device auto restore from a specific image in a USB drive disc or normal restore from a normal image failed
Description: Device auto restore from USB drive image failed due to USB drive not found
Format: Device %s restore from %s image failed due to %s
Variables: Device ${restore_type} restore from ${image_source} image failed for ${reason}
Name: Creating USB auto restore image failed
Sample: Creation of USB auto restore image failed due to no USB drive
Description: Creation of USB auto restore image failed due to %s
Format: Creation of USB auto restore image failed due to %s
Variables: Creation of USB auto restore image failed: ${reason}
Sample: System backup to USB drive failed due to write file to USB drive error
Description: System backup %s%s failed due to %s.
Format: System backup %s%s failed due to %s.
Name: USB auto restore failed reason
Sample: USB auto restore failed due to not detect the USB drive
Description: USB auto restore failed due to %s
Format: USB auto restore failed due to %s
Variables: USB auto restore failed for ${reason}
Sample: A user successfully logged in. The log message specifies the user type, user name, and IP address.
Description: Management user admin from 10.0.1.2 logged in
Sample: A user log in attempt failed. The log message specifies the user type, user name, IP address, and the failure reason, if available.
Description: Management user admin from 10.0.1.2 log in attempt was rejected.
Format: %s %s%s%s from %s log in attempt was rejected%s%s%s%s
Sample: A user successfully logged out. The log message specifies the user type, user name, and IP address.
Description: Management user admin from 10.0.1.2 logged out
Sample: Authentication server 192.168.1.1:389 is not responding
Description: The external authentication server is not available.
Format: Authentication server %s:%d is not responding
Sample: The user successfully authenticated. The log message specifies whether this is an administrative user, a firewall user, or another type of user.
Description: Authentication of firewall user [user1@Firebox-DB] from 198.51.100.2 was accepted
Format: Authentication of %s user [%s@%s] from %s was accepted
Variables: Authentication of ${user_type} user [${user_name}@${auth_server}] from ${ipaddr} was accepted.
Sample: "Authentication of MUVPN user [user1@Firebox-DB] from 198.51.100.2 was rejected, password is incorrect"
Description: User authentication failed. The log message specifies the reason.
Format: Authentication of %s user [%s@%s] from %s was rejected, %s
Variables: "Authentication of ${user_type} user [${user_name}@${auth_server}] from ${ip_addr} was rejected, ${reason}"
Sample: It indicates a user unlock and how he/she is unlocked
Description: User test is unlocked automatically
Sample: It indicates a user lockout and how and why he/she is locked out
Description: User test is locked out briefly after 3 login failures
Format: User %s is locked out %s after %d login failures
Variables: User ${name} is locked out ${lockout_type} after ${failure_count} login failures
Name: BOVPN TLS client authentication failed
Sample: "Authentication of BOVPN TLS client [EasternOffice] from 198.51.100.2 was rejected, pre-shared key is incorrect"
Description: BOVPN TLS client authentication failed. The log message specifies the reason.
Format: Authentication of BOVPN TLS client [%s] from %s was rejected, %s
Variables: "Authentication of BOVPN TLS client [${client_name}] from ${ip_addr} was rejected, ${reason}"
Name: Firebox connected to SSO agent
Sample: Firebox connected to the SSO agent at 10.0.1.25 successfully.
Description: Firebox connected to the SSO agent successfully
Format: Firebox connected to the SSO agent at %s successfully.
Sample: Firebox closed the connection to the SSO agent at 10.0.1.25.
Description: Firebox closed the connection to the SSO agent.
Format: Firebox closed the connection to the SSO agent at %s.
Name: Firebox failed to connect to the SSO agent
Sample: Firebox failed to connect to the SSO agent at 10.0.1.25. Reason: timeout.
Description: Firebox failed to connect to the SSO agent.
Format: Firebox failed to connect to the SSO agent at %s. Reason: %s.
Sample: SSO Agent failover from 10.0.1.25 to 10.0.1.26 was successful.
Format: SSO Agent failover from %s to %s was successful.
Sample: SSO agent failover from 10.0.1.25 to 10.0.1.26 failed. Reason: incompatible SSO agent version.
Format: SSO agent failover from %s to %s failed. Reason: %s.
Sample: Authentication failed. The log message specifies the reason.
Description: Authentication error. Domain not found for user1.
Sample: Authentication of user [user1@example.com] failed. Both primary and secondary servers are unavailable.
Description: Authentication failed because both the primary and secondary authentication servers are unavailable.
Format: Authentication of user [%s@%s] failed. Both primary and secondary servers are unavailable.
Sample: Authentication of firewall user [user1@RADIUS] failed. RADIUS authentication method MSCHAP_V1 is not supported.
Description: Authentication failed because the specified RADIUS method is not supported.
Format: Authentication of %s user [%s@%s] failed. RADIUS authentication method %s is not supported.
Sample: Authentication failed because the maximum number of groups has been reached.
Description: The maximum number of groups (31) has been reached
Format: The maximum number of groups (%d) has been reached
Sample: The CA certificate updated successfully to the specified new version.
Description: CA certificate updated successfully to version 1.3.
Format: CA certificate updated successfully to version %s.
Variables: CA certificate updated successfully to version ${new CA version number}.
Sample: CA certificate update failed. Current CA certificate version: 1.2.
Format: CA certificate update failed. Current CA certificate version: %s.
Variables: CA certificate update failed. Current CA certificate version: ${current CA version number}.
Sample: Management useradmin@Firebox-DBfrom 10.139.36.22 {modified | added | deleted } Blocked Sites Exceptions
Description: The device configuration has been changed.
Name: Administrative accounts reset to default
Sample: The administrative accounts were returned to the default settings. This could be because the system is in safe mode, or because of a corrupted administrative account file.
Description: Administrative accounts were reset to the default settings
Format: Administrative accounts were reset to the default settings
Sample: An administrator added a feature key. The log message specifies the feature key ID.
Sample: An administrator has removed a feature key. The log message specifies the feature key ID.
Sample: 'LIVESECURITY' feature expired. Contact WatchGuard to renew your subscription.
Format: '%s' feature expired. Contact WatchGuard to renew your subscription.
Sample: A feature will soon expire. The log message specifies the feature and the number of days until it expires.
Description: 'LIVESECURITY' feature will expire in 90 days.
Format: '%s' feature will expire in %d days.
Name: Default device settings in use for safe mode
Sample: The device configuration was reset to the default settings because the device is in safe mode.
Description: Device default configuration was loaded in safe mode
Format: Device default configuration was loaded in safe mode
Sample: The RapidDeploy package from the LiveSecurity service was successfully applied to the device.
Description: RapidDeploy package was applied successfully
Format: RapidDeploy package was applied successfully
Sample: The RapidDeploy package was not applied to the device. The log message specifies the reason.
Description: RapidDeploy package was not applied: Cannot find result.xml
Format: RapidDeploy package was not applied: %s
Name: New RSS feed update succeeded
Sample: New RSS feed from the LiveSecurity Service was updated.
Description: New RSS feed from LiveSecurity Service was updated
Format: New RSS feed from LiveSecurity Service was updated
Name: New RSS feed update failed
Sample: New RSS feed from LiveSecurity Service was not updated: error retrieving response from server
Description: New RSS feed from the LiveSecurity Service failed to update.
Format: New RSS feed from LiveSecurity Service was not updated: %s
Sample: The feature key for the device was successfully downloaded from the LiveSecurity Service.
Description: Feature key from LiveSecurity Service was received
Format: Feature key from LiveSecurity Service was received
Sample: The feature key could not be downloaded from the LiveSecurity Service. The log message specifies the reason.
Description: Feature key from LiveSecurity Service was not received: error parsing response from LiveSecurity service
Format: Feature key from LiveSecurity Service was not received: %s
Name: Wireless country specification update succeeded
Sample: The wireless country specification was successfully updated from the LiveSecurity service.
Description: Wireless country specification was updated
Format: Wireless country specification was updated
Name: Wireless country specification update failed
Sample: The wireless country specification could not be downloaded from the LiveSecurity service. The log message specifies the failure reason and the number of retries.
Description: Wireless country specification from LiveSecurity Service was not received: received error code <n> from LSS
Format: Wireless country specification from LiveSecurity Service was not received: %s, (retry_count=%d)
Name: RapidDeploy configuration from USB succeeded
Sample: The RapidDeploy configuration was successfully applied from a USB drive.
Description: RapidDeploy configuration from a USB drive was applied successfully
Format: RapidDeploy configuration from a USB drive was applied successfully
Name: RapidDeploy configuration from USB failed
Sample: The RapidDeploy configuration was not successfully applied from a USB drive. The log message specifies the reason.
Description: RapidDeploy configuration from a USB drive was not applied: config line missing
Format: RapidDeploy configuration from a USB drive was not applied: %s
Sample: The device successfully connected to the WatchGuard Log Server designated as the primary server.
Description: Connected to the primary Log Server at 198.51.100.0
Format: Connected to the primary Log Server at %s
Sample: The device successfully connected to the WatchGuard Log Server designated as the backup server.
Description: Connected to the backup Log Server at 198.51.100.0
Format: Connected to the backup Log Server at %s
Name: Device configuration update with audit trail

Sample: The updated configuration file was successfully sent to the device from the specified Management Server. The log message indicates if the feature key was updated. The log message might also specify the revision ID and includes comments about the update.

Description: The configuration file and feature key for the device were successfully updated after a request from admin from the Management Server at 10.139.44.88. Revision: dummy_config_rev_id. Comments: update tcp segment.
Format: The configuration file %s for the device %s successfully updated after a request from %s from the Management Server at %s.%s%s%s%s.
Sample: The device retrieved an updated configuration file from the specified Management Server. The log message also indicates if device retrieved a feature key.
Description: Device configuration file was successfully updated. Configuration file retrieved from the Management Server at 10.139.44.88.
Format: Device configuration file %s successfully updated. Configuration file retrieved from the Management Server at %s.
Sample: The IPSec certificate was successfully imported from the Management Server at 10.139.44.88.
Description: The IPsec certificate was successfully imported from the specified Management Server.
Format: The IPSec certificate was successfully imported from the Management Server at %s.
Name: Management Server CA certificate import
Sample: The Management Server CA certificate was successfully imported from the Management Server at 10.139.44.88.
Description: The Management Server CA certificate was successfully imported from the specified Management Server.
Format: The Management Server CA certificate was successfully imported from the Management Server at %s.
Sample: System time changed to 2012-08-29 08:20:00 by NTP
Description: The system time was changed by the NTP process.
Format: System time changed to %s by NTP
Sample: 'LIVESECURITY' feature expired (Tue May 14 12:25:00 2013) prior to package release date (Wed May 15 01:00:00 2013 )
Description: 'LIVESECURITY' feature expired (%s) prior to package release date (%s)
Format: 'LIVESECURITY' feature expired (%s) prior to package release date (%s)
Variables: 'LIVESECURITY' feature expired (${expiration time}) prior to package release date (${package release time})
Sample: "System upgrade to 11.9 successful, system needs to reboot"
Variables: System upgrade to ${software version} successful ${box need reboot or not}
Sample: System is automatically rebooting at 12:09
Description: System is automatically rebooting at %d:%d
Format: System is automatically rebooting at %d:%d
Variables: System is automatically rebooting at ${hour}:${second}
Sample: System time changed from 2012-10-5 12:30:15 to 2012-10-6 14:10:00
Description: System time changed from %s to %s
Format: System time changed from %s to %s
Variables: System time changed from ${old value} to ${new value}
Sample: "'LIVESECURITY' feature will expire on Sat., Jan 5, 11:27:23 CST 2013."
Variables: 'LIVESECURITY' feature will expire on ${expiration time}
Name: Configuration reset failed during a downgrade
Sample: "During a system downgrade, the configuration reset failed"
Description: During a system downgrade, the configuration reset failed
Format: During a system downgrade, the configuration reset failed
Sample: Device auto restore from a specific image in USB drive or normal restore from a normal image
Description: Device auto restore from USB drive succeeded
Format: Device %s restore from %s image succeeded
Variables: Device ${restore_type} restore from ${image_source} image succeeded
Name: USB auto restore image created
Sample: USB auto restore image successfully created
Description: USB auto restore image successfully created
Format: USB auto restore image successfully created
Sample: Device was restored from a saved backup image. The backup image was either auto restored from a USB drive or restored from another location.
Description: "Device auto restore from USB drive image initiated, reboot needed"
Format: Device %s restore from %s image initiated%s
Variables: Device ${restore_type} restore from ${image_source} image initiated${reboot_option}
Sample: Device was restored from a saved backup image. The backup image was either auto restored from a USB drive or restored from another location.
Description: "Device auto restore from USB drive image initiated, reboot needed"
Format: Device %s restore from %s image initiated%s
Variables: Device ${restore_type} restore from ${image_source} image initiated${reboot_option}
Sample: System upgrade failed: 'LIVESECURITY' feature expired
Sample: A user log in attempt failed. The log message specifies the UI type, User Name, IP address, and (if available) the failure reason.
Description: WSM User status from 10.0.1.2 log in attempt was rejected - Invalid credentials.
Format: %s %s@%s from %s log in attempt was rejected - %s.
Variables: %{ui_type} ${user_name}@${auth_server} from ${ipaddr} log in attempt was rejected ${msg}.
